meanings.definition: An injury to the body, typically involving a break in the skin.
meanings.sent1: The doctor treated the wounds on the patient's arm.
meanings.sent2: She cleaned the wounds carefully to prevent infection.
meanings.sent3: The bandages on the wounds made the patient look like a mummy.
meanings.sent4: His emotional wounds were deeper than any physical injury.
meanings.sent5: The wounds from the accident left a lasting scar on his memory.

meanings.definition: To inflict an injury on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He wounds easily, so be gentle with him.
meanings.sent2: The hunter wounded the deer with his arrow.
meanings.sent3: Her harsh words wounded his feelings deeply.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal wounded him more than any physical harm could.
meanings.sent5: His careless actions wounded the trust of his friends.
